intro: Torilis gracilis, commonly known as slender hogweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are deeply lobed and can be mistaken for similar species, requiring careful identification. Torilis gracilis is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
